meta_description: The Boston Athenaeum is a unique combination of library, museum, and cultural center in a magnificent landmark building.
hours_text:
## Visit

Welcome to the most interesting place in Boston.

A gathering place for words, art, and ideas, our landmark 12-story building is an essential destination for those seeking authentic Boston.

[Day Membership](http://web.archive.org/web/20251228114111/https://bostonathenaeum.org/visit/day-passes/) [Take a Tour](http://web.archive.org/web/20251228114111/https://bostonathenaeum.org/visit/take-a-tour/)

### Where History Breathes and Curiosity Thrives

Within these walls, you’re part of an unbroken literary conversation that once included Louisa May Alcott, Ralph Waldo Emerson, Nathaniel Hawthorne, and John Quincy Adams—and continues with today’s poets, scholars, and the delightfully bookish. Our community welcomes everyone with a spark of curiosity, bringing life to these historic rooms through a shared love of words and unexpected connections.

### Treasures and Hidden Corners

Let our collections captivate you—from rare first editions to today’s bestsellers, from ever-changing art exhibitions, to priceless gems like George Washington’s personal library. Settle into a sun-dappled reading room, or wander into Folio for literary-inspired refreshments and lively conversations with fellow book lovers.

## Six Ways to Explore

  * **One Day Membership** : Enjoy all floors, including our fifth-floor terrace with marvelous views—and our resident falcons
  * **First Floor Admission:** Browse our collection and experience rotating exhibitions
  * **Art & Architecture Tour**: In...
admission_text:
### Where History Breathes and Curiosity Thrives

Within these walls, you’re part of an unbroken literary conversation that once included Louisa May Alcott, Ralph Waldo Emerson, Nathaniel Hawthorne, and John Quincy Adams—and continues with today’s poets, scholars, and the delightfully bookish. Our community welcomes everyone with a spark of curiosity, bringing life to these historic rooms through a shared love of words and unexpected connections.

### Treasures and Hidden Corners

Let our collections captivate you—from rare first editions to today’s bestsellers, from ever-changing art exhibitions, to priceless gems like George Washington’s personal library. Settle into a sun-dappled reading room, or wander into Folio for literary-inspired refreshments and lively conversations with fellow book lovers.

## Six Ways to Explore

  * **One Day Membership** : Enjoy all floors, including our fifth-floor terrace with marvelous views—and our resident falcons
  * **First Floor Admission:** Browse our collection and experience rotating exhibitions
  * **Art & Architecture Tour**: Includes first-floor admission
  * **Attend an Event:** From author talks to hands-on activities
  * **Make a Research Appointment:** Explore our special collections
  * **Become a Member** : [Join our community](http://web.archive.org/web/20251228114111/https://bostonathenaeum.org/join-give/become-a-member/)

### One Day Membership

One-day memberships are available for $40 [online](http://web.archive.org/web/...
accessibility_text:
# Accessibility Guide

# Accessibility Guide

The Boston Athenaeum welcomes people of all abilities as visitors and members. Staff members strive to foster an inclusive and accessible environment.

Contact [Member and Visitor Services](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101043408/mailto:membership@bostonathenaeum.org) by email or 617-720-7604 if you need accommodations, seek information beyond the scope of this guide, or see anything in the guide that needs to be updated.

This guide was last updated April 20, 2023.

## Resources and Services

Many library members and visitors find it helpful to consult with our Reference and Circulation staff to access books and other library materials. For further information refer to the [Using the Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101043408/https://bostonathenaeum.org/explore-learn/library/using-the-library/) page.

In addition to the physical collection, the library offers digital access to select resources. Additional resources onsite may include:

  * Magnifying glasses
  * Neat Boards
  * Portable lamps for checkout
  * Assistive listening devices
  * Large print text binders

## Tours

Docents and guides speak without amplification and use a combination of stairs and elevators. Information on tour types and scheduling a private/group tour is available on the[ Take a Tour page](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101043408/https://bostonathenaeum.org/visit/take-a-tour/). collections_text:
) 

## Joy of discovery. Power of place. 

A member supported library, museum, and cultural center that everyone is invited to join.

[About Us](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105162122/https://bostonathenaeum.org/about/) [Join](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105162122/https://bostonathenaeum.org/join-give/become-a-member/)

## What’s New

###  [Allan Rohan Crite: Griot of Boston](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105162122/https://bostonathenaeum.org/whats-on/exhibitions/allan-rohan-crite-griot-of-boston/)

Opens October 23, 2025, in the Norma Jean Calderwood Gallery, featuring the work of South End and Lower Roxbury artist Allan Rohan Crite.

###  [Dine at Folio Bistro](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105162122/https://www.thecateredaffair.com/folio/)

Enjoy French and Mediterranean-inspired cuisine with a glass of wine or signature cocktail. Reservations are available via Resy.

## At a Glance

1807 

year founded 

One of the country’s oldest and most distinguished member-supported libraries. 

500,000

circulating books 

From first editions to the latest bestsellers. 

12

levels 

Book stacks, art, reading rooms, terraces, and more. 

## Become a Member

For a day or a lifetime, explore the most interesting place in Boston. 

[Day Memberships](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105162122/https://bostonathenaeum.org/visit/day-passes/) [Join Now](http://web.archive.org/web/20260105162122/https://bostonathenaeum.org/join-give/become-a-member/)
